Working Memory Capacity.description: The amount of information that can be held in mind and manipulated at once.

Attentional Control.description: Ability to focus attention and resist distractions.

Problem Solving.description: Ability to find solutions to problems.

Learning.description: Acquisition of new information and skills.

Selective Attention.description: Ability to focus on relevant information and ignore irrelevant information.

Inhibitory Control.description: Ability to suppress irrelevant thoughts and actions.

Decision Making.description: Process of selecting a course of action.

Creativity.description: Ability to generate novel and useful ideas.

Knowledge Acquisition.description: Process of acquiring and storing new information.

Skill Development.description: Process of improving skills through practice.

Focus.description: Maintaining attention on a specific task.

Impulse Control.description: Resisting the urge to act impulsively.

Speed of Decision.description: Speed at which decisions are made.

Encoding.description: Process of storing information in memory.

Expertise.description: High level of skill and knowledge in a specific area.
